column1: Rangapara (IPA: ˈræŋgəˌpɑːrə) is a town and a municipal board in Sonitpur district in the Indian state of Assam.
Rangapara is located at 26.82°N 92.65°E﻿ / 26.82; 92.65. It has an average elevation of 206 metres (675 feet).

column3: 822. Males constitute 54% of the population and females 46%. Rangapara has an average literacy rate of 76%
column4: higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 81%
column5: and female literacy is 70%. In Rangapara
column6: 10% of the population is under 6 years of age.

column1: The Rangapara North Junction which lies on the Rangia-Murkongselek section has trains to Kamakhya Junction
Rangapara is part of Tezpur (Lok Sabha constituency).
